doc.previous: As a child Whitcomb was fascinated by airplanes he built models and flew them in competitions always striving to improve their performance He graduated from Worcester Polytechnic Institute in 1943 with a BS in aeronautical engineering and promptly gained employment at the Langley Research Center operated by the National Advisory Committee for Aeronautics NACA and its successor NASA
